summary: This is a court scheduling order notification from the Southern District of Florida covering multiple civil cases (Doe v. Epstein) filed against Jeffrey Epstein in 2008. It sets trial dates for January 2010, establishes discovery deadlines, and refers cases to mediation and Magistrate Judge Linnea R. Johnson. The document includes attorney notification information for multiple plaintiffs' lawyers.

keyFacts: Multiple civil cases (Doe v. Epstein) were consolidated with a joint trial date set for January 25, 2010.
At least five separate Doe cases (Doe, Doe No. 3, Doe No. 4, Doe No. 5) against Jeffrey Epstein are referenced in this single scheduling order.
The cases were referred to Magistrate Judge Linnea R. Johnson for discovery proceedings and to mediation.
Numerous attorneys were involved in representing plaintiffs across the different cases, indicating multiple legal teams pursuing claims against Epstein.
The document shows the federal court system managing multiple related civil cases against Epstein with coordinated scheduling.
